ARABIC: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is not fitting for the All-Merciful to have a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When it does not behove the Merciful to have a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: It does not befit the Most Compassionate Lord that He should take a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Beneficent God is too Exalted to have a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And it does not befit the Most Gracious to choose an offspring!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But it is not suitable for the Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And it is not worthy of the Beneficent Allah that He should take (to Himself) a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and it behoves not the All-merciful to take a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He should choose a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It does not become the majesty of the Compassionate God to take to Himself a son:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And it behoveth not the Compassionate that he should take a son. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It does not behoove the All-beneficent to take a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But it is not suitable for (the Majesty of) the Most Beneficent (Allah) that He should beget a son (or offspring or children).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: It is not for the Merciful to take a son!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It is not fitting for the Most Merciful to have a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:92] when it is not meet for [the Majesty of] the Compassionate One to take a son, that is to say, such a thing does not befit Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He should choose a son) It does not befit him to take Ezra as a son.
